description.p: You can use your spellcasting focus to help revitalize your wounded allies during a short rest. If you or any friendly creatures who can see, hear, taste or smell your creation regain hit points at the end of the short rest by spending one or more Hit Dice, each of those creatures regains an extra 1d6 hit points.
The extra hit points increase when you reach certain levels in this class: to 1d8 at 9th level, to 1d10 at 13th level, and to 1d12 at 17th level.

description.p: When you suffer a level of exhaustion as a result of ending an adventuring day without eating enough food, you can ignore the effects of your exhaustion. While you do so, your ki point maximum is reduced by 1 for each level of exhaustion you ignore. You still acquire levels of exhaustion while you ignore the effects, and you can't ignore effects suffered for any other reason.
You can ignore a number of levels of exhaustion in this way up to your proficiency bonus.

description.p: You adopt a particular set of skills associated with hunting in the areas you favor. Choose one of the following options.
You can’t take a Hunting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.
You prefer to lie in wait and take out your prey from afar. You gain proficiency with the Stealth skill and a +2 bonus to damage rolls for attacks made with ranged weapons.

You respect natures many difficulties and use them to your advantage in battle. Difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel and you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures affected by difficult terrain.
You barrel through the wilderness, destroying all in your path. You gain proficiency with heavy armor and your walking speed increases by 10 feet while you wear heavy armor.

You rely on magic to entrap your prey and weaken their ability to fight. You learn the thorn whip cantrip. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you can add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with this cantrip.

At 2nd level, you learn the snare spell, which doesn't count against your number of spells known, and you can cast it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus without expending spell slots. You regain all uses of this casting when you finish a long rest.

description.p: Your patron bestows upon a you a ceremonial chalice that is always full of your blood and can't spill no matter its orientation. You can use the chalice as a spellcasting focus for you warlock spells, and you can drink from it when you roll Hit Dice during a short rest to regain an additional number of hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

Additionally, you learn the detect poison and disease spell and the purify food and drink spell, which don't count against your number of spells known. You can cast each as a ritual once, and you regain your ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
